SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: <a class="title may-blank " href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-31784538" tabindex="1">Boko Haram 'joins Islamic State'</a>

Now there's IS presence in Africa, I will be interested in how Obama, Cameron, Merkel and other Western leaders tackle the issue. It could be catastrophic if they managed to expand even further.
I thought Boko Haram were already an offshoot of ISIS

I thought Boko Haram were already an offshoot of ISIS
No, they were an offshoot of Bobo's Clown School, except not as scary as for-real clowns.
Will we see air strikes against Boko Haram targets now do you think?

I don't know, but I guess it's now likely that whatever solution is found for ISIS will also be applied to Boko Horam, which should hopefully be a good thing as neither can continue as they've been going on.
That part of the world is in a real mess, honestly what are the options to sort it out?
Though this isn't good, I doubt it will really change anything for either of them. ISIS is too busy in Iraq and Syria to help Boko Haram, just as Boko Haram is too busy in Nigeria to assist IS
Well to be fair a fair few of problems in the Middle East are down to France and Britain.

I suppose it's only a matter of time before Al-Shabaab also joins Islamic State. It's an interesting situation to see the caliphate stretch from the Middle East through nontrivial parts of Africa.

Here's why this is a good thing. Clash of egos. These two groups like taking credit for horrific acts I wonder if Boko and ISIL can co-exist. It may lead to leaks and internal problems that can help the west diffuse potential activity

I saw that coming miles ahead. The abduction of school girls to be sex slave for Jihadis, the recent beheadings, the kidnappings - these are some of the strongest indicators that they were heading in that direction.

Now the question is, will any country now send their soldiers to fight Boko Haram in Nigeria? IMHO, I think the Boko Haram's leader should have been taken out when he abducted those school girls - yet nothing happened.
Boko Haram? I thought we took them out with our clever hashtag PR campaign....

Can anyone ELI5 what this even means

I doubt they had any other options, kidnapping christian schoolgirls and selling them into slavery is something most takfiri terrorist groups ideologically approve of but no way are they going to publicly take credit for it, good for business but bad for marketing, that sort of thing. ISIS on the other hand, the more depraved the more eager they are to boast about it.
Masked men making lengthy press releases with constant religious and violent references.

2 Islamist militant groups that butcher minorities and impose Sharia law are joining forces. In theory it means that Boko Haram now responds to ISIS central command in Iraq. Whether that actually happens remains to be seen.

The real reason that this is bad news is because it's a huge boon to the ISIS brand. Between this and the increasing number of AQ affiliates that have pledged allegiance to ISIS, there seems to be a trend of unaffiliated Islamist groups coalescing under one banner.

Two groups of men wanting to impose their version of Islam, such as preventing girls from learning or non-Muslims from enjoying life, are officially joining. It means that they both think an Islamic State is a possibility, so they're joining early. In reality, it means that there are more bad guys for the UK, US, Jordan, UAE, etc, to fight, and for Saudi Arabia to finance.
I guess we don't need for President Johnathan to ask for help with the situation, which he never would've. I guess that's a positive.
